      • setMinFrameCount

        public void setMinFrameCount(int frameCount)
        Creates at a minimum the given number of frames (frameCount). Therefore the currently active DefaultComponentBuilder will be used to create the FrameComponents. So if you want to have Frames created with a user-defined FrameComponent use the method setDefaultFrameComponentBuilder() to register a specific DefaultFrameComponentBuilder.
        Parameters:
        frameCount -

      • setDefaultFrameComponentBuilder

        public void setDefaultFrameComponentBuilder(DefaultFrameComponentBuilder defaultFrameComponentBuilder)
        Registers a class that delivers new instances of a default FrameComponent which should be inserted if, due to the selected layout, empty Frames would appear.
        Parameters:
        defaultFrameComponentBuilder -

      • setLayout

        public void setLayout(MultiFrameLayout layout)
        Set/ apply a new layout, this will be used to layout the FrameComponent's (and it's Frame's). Each MultiFramePanel is able to layout MultiFramePanel .numberOfFramesLayedOut( ) FrameComponent's. If there are already not enough FrameComponent's registered at the MultiFramePanel n default FrameComponent's will appear. Where n is the difference between the number of FrameComponent's that can be layout by the MultiFramePanel and the number of FrameComponent's already registered at the MultiFramePanel. What FrameComponent's should be inserted per default can be controlled by registering a DefaultFrameComponentBuilder via the setDefaultFrameComponentBuilder method
        Parameters:
        layout -
